intro: Brodiaea grandiflora var. brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stemmed brodiaea, is a bulbous perennial native to California. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its compact size and elegant flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
